content.description: Sit start with your left hand underclinging on the lowest rail and right hand on a pinch on the arete. Pull on with a kneebar and make a long move up to the sloper curved rail above, match it and then move up to the lip. Surf the lip to the high point of the boulder and top out.
content.protection: A couple of pads, the landing is a hill that slopes up and can be odd to pad with a single pad.
content.location: This is the first boulder you will come to on the approach, which sits downhill from the main section of the wall.

content.description:
You don't often get to do a foot jam, arm-bar, and finger lock on a boulder problem. Well you can on this one. Sit start and on the crimps at the bottom of the flared section of the crack and climb it straight up. 

 The top out may still be a little sandy but will get better over time.
content.location: This is the obvious crack line on the center-right of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start and climb the series of large flat holds that trend slightly left. This has not received a proper cleaning yet and may get another star when it does.
content.location: The obvious dyke on the right/center part of the wall.

content.description: Sit start on the vertical seam, make a long pull up to the edge up and left. From there move left and match on the edge before moving to the lip and a hidden hold and then top out to the left.
content.location: Sit start on the obvious vertical seam on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: A great place to go on a solo mission. This is a 10-12 foot vertical wall with solid rock and safe, easily padded landings. Currently established problems range from v0- to v3-4 with potential for a couple of harder problems.
